channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2023100913
item.description:
Report E-2023100913

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of UN3082 "Elco 105" was released to a 4’ x 4’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a puncture caused by other freight. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment to continue on. The impacted area was cleaned with absorbents. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a cubic yard box and a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023100527
item.description:
Report X-2023100527

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2023100527 SequenceEvent: found in the hazmat cage. did inspection found there to be leaking. DescribePack: both of the plastic jerry cans have leaked out their caps, the caps appear tight but crossed threaded. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: all was put into the hazmat cage, then into a plastic spill bag and a black tote. 2. X-2023100528 SequenceEvent: found the box wet and in the hazmat cage. DescribePack: once opened found that both of the plastic jerry cans have leaked a small amount of their contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: all was put into the hazmat cage in black tote and in a plastic spill bag.

item.title: Report X-2023100526
item.description:
Report X-2023100526

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the box in the hazmat cage, upon inspection found the box to look as though the top has damaged from a drop? DescribePack: The box has damage to the top that indicates a drop from the sorting line or due to the P.H. the bottom is also damaged and wet, as if when turned back over the contents leaked down the sides and damaged the box on the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All was put into the hazmat cage inside of a plastic spill bag, and then into a tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100525
item.description:
Report X-2023100525

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the box in the hazmat cage. preformed an inspection. DescribePack: Found the box to be wet and corroding. once opened found there to be 2 plastic bottles, both have child proof caps but no inner bottle seals. It appears as though the box may have been dropped or fell off of the sorting line? Both bottles have leaked a small amount of their contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: All was put into the hazmat cage in a plastic spill bag and in a black tote.

item.title: Report X-2023091107
item.description:
Report X-2023091107

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR LEAKING PACKAGE. SPILL WAS CONTAINED AND TAKEN TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. WHEN PACKAGE WAS OPENED FOR DAMAGE INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND THAT THERE WERE AEROSOL CANS INSIDE SECONDARY BOXES THAT HAD LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND. THE OUTER CARTON WAS NOT MARKED WITH LIMITED QUANTITY DIAMOND. RMP WAS NOTIFIED AND PICTURES TAKEN. RMP CALLED HAZMAT HELP DESK.

item.title: Report X-2023090200
item.description:
Report X-2023090200

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-01
  • City: WAUKESHA
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023090200- A fiberboard box was found with signs of release at the ZMLA facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained plastic 1L bottles of Sodium Hydroxide 0.100 normal and Sulfuric acid 0.100 normal. The Sodium Hydroxide is a regulated substance UN1987. The fiberboard box was a un spec package however there were no hazardous material labels or paperwork on the package. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held for the FAA. X-2023090202-A fiberboard box was found with signs of release at the ZMLA facility during sort operations. The fiberboard box contained plastic 1L bottles of Sodium Hydroxide 0.100 normal and Sulfuric acid 0.100 normal. The Sodium Hydroxide is a regulated substance UN1987. The fiberboard box was a un spec package however there were no hazardous material labels or paperwork on the package. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023090798
item.description:
Report X-2023090798

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-04T06:23:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THIS PACKAGE WAS ORIGINALLY PART OF A DIFFERENT LEAKER AND THE OUTER PACKAGING WAS LEAKED ON AND SOILED. UPON OPENING THE HAZMAT PACKAGE IT WAS FOUND TO ALSO BE LEAKING BUT HAD NOT YET LEAKED THROUGH TO THE OUTER PACKAGING. RESPONDER PROCESSED LEAKER THROUGH DMP.
